definitions.definition: a shape made up of curves, each one above or wider than the one before:
a situation in which a price, etc. becomes lower, or a situation gets worse and is difficult to control because one bad event causes another:
examples: This year's downward spiral of house prices has depressed the market.
With one wing damaged, the model airplane spiralled downwards.

definitions.definition: If costs, prices, etc. spiral, they increase faster and faster:
(of prices, etc.) to become less, at a faster and faster rate
If a situation spirals, it quickly gets worse in a way that becomes more and more difficult to control:
examples: Violence in the country is threatening to spiral out of control.

definitions.definition: shaped in a series of curves, each one above or wider than the one before:
